text: Hey folks, I am getting some new errors when using Plotly and the Eirene package for homological calculations. The error is `LoadError: InitError: SystemError: opening file "/home/krishnab/.julia/packages/PlotlyJS/m2Lzd/deps/build.log": No such file or directory`. Was there some change? I am using Julia 1.6 RC, but most everything seems to work without issue.

elements.text: Hey folks, I am getting some new errors when using Plotly and the Eirene package for homological calculations. The error is
LoadError: InitError: SystemError: opening file "/home/krishnab/.julia/packages/PlotlyJS/m2Lzd/deps/build.log": No such file or directory
. Was there some change? I am using Julia 1.6 RC, but most everything seems to work without issue.
Try
] build PlotlyJS

text: See if it's got into a weird state

elements.text: See if it's got into a weird state

text:
Hey <@U6A936746> thanks so much for the suggestion. I tried what you suggested which seemed to help, but got stuck in some circular loop between Plots, PlotlyJS, and Plotly. So I just deleted all of my package etc., in the `.julia` folder and rebuilt. Thanks too for the new install and build messages when installing, it helps a lot. But for some reason the plots are still messed, and I am not sure why. Like things are building and I wrote `using Plots; plotlyjs()` with no issue. But then I wrote a simple function to test plots and I am getting weird messages like this.,

```julia> plot(x, y)
┌ Warning: _display is not defined for this backend.
└ @ Plots ~/.julia/packages/Plots/SjqWU/src/output.jl:194```
Weird. Not sure what is going on there. I can work with GR for now, I will ask if anyone is having the same trouble with plotly in the <#C6E4SU1D3|plotting> channel. Thanks again.

weird

```julia> plotlyjs()
ERROR: InitError: SystemError: opening file "/home/krishnab/.julia/packages/PlotlyJS/m2Lzd/deps/build.log": No such file or directory

    @ ./io.jl:328 [inlined]
